definition: to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: As soon as you prove to be good, you will get more followers.
sentences.chinese: 如果事實證明你還不錯，必定會有更多追隨者。

sentences.english: That' s after a US-Iraqi crackdown against his followers continues.
sentences.chinese: 那之後，美國和伊拉克打擊他的追隨者仍在繼續。

sentences.english: I'm largely a follower of a plant-based diet, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我也是植物性飲食的熱心追隨者。

sentences.english: In the wake of the scandal, the senator's one-time adherents quietly deserted him.
sentences.chinese: 因爲醜聞，該參議院昔日的追隨者悄然棄他而去。

sentences.english: His followers adopted the custom of wearing a Shamrock on his feast day.
sentences.chinese: 他的追隨者在他的宗教節日採取了佩帶三葉草風俗。

sentences.english: His followers adopted the custom of wearing a shamrock on his feast day .
sentences.chinese: 因此，他的追隨者在節日當天都佩帶三葉草。

sentences.english: She and a small group of her followers pursued Illidan through the portal.
sentences.chinese: 她和一小部分追隨者追蹤伊利丹越過了傳送門。

sentences.english: Delia's followers are thinking inside the box this Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 迪莉婭的追隨者們正在思考這個聖誕節節禮。

sentences.english: However, some people criticized the Objectivists and their followers.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些人批評的客觀主義及其追隨者。

sentences.english: A believer in or adherent of Islam.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯蘭教的信徒或追隨者。

sentences.english: All his followers looked up to him as a wise and courageous man.
sentences.chinese: 他的追隨者都欽佩他智勇雙全。

sentences.english: Do not be to overbearing at the outset, otherwise you will not have any followers.
sentences.chinese: 不要一開始就搞專制，否則你不會有任何追隨者。

sentences.english: My followers, unlike yours, are loyal to their oaths.
sentences.chinese: 我的追隨者，不像你的那樣，忠於他們的誓言。

sentences.english: Savvy managers should treat each type differently, she argues.
sentences.chinese: 凱勒曼說明智的管理人員應當區別對待各類追隨者。

sentences.english: His words caused a great deal of dissention among his followers .
sentences.chinese: 他的話在他的追隨者中引起許多爭論。

sentences.english: Ms. Yang, one of China's best-known celebrities, commands a sizable following in this demographic.
sentences.chinese: 作爲中國最知名的人物之一，楊瀾擁有一大批追隨者。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
